title: 3×3 Matrix Inverse Methods Quiz
description: Test your understanding of different methods for finding 3×3 matrix inverses.

questions.question: Which method transforms [A|I] to [I|A⁻¹]?
questions.explanation: Gauss elimination transforms the augmented matrix to find the inverse.

questions.question: In the determinant method, what is A⁻¹ equal to?
questions.explanation: A⁻¹ = (1/det(A)) × adj(A), where adj(A) is the adjoint (transpose of cofactor matrix).

questions.question: What should you do first when finding a 3×3 inverse?
questions.explanation: First verify the matrix is invertible by checking det ≠ 0.

questions.question: Which method is generally more efficient for 3×3 matrices?
questions.explanation: Gauss elimination is more efficient and numerically stable.

questions.question: What is the adjoint matrix?
options: The transpose of the cofactor matrix
The determinant of the cofactor matrix
The inverse of the cofactor matrix
questions.explanation: The adjoint is the transpose of the cofactor matrix.
